metadata.title: How to Make Easy Thin Palaada or Rice Crepes | Malabar-Kerala Recipe | With Rice Flour
metadata.description:
Palaada or Rice crepe is very famous in Kerala cuisine, these are paper thin crepes made with rice, egg and coconut milk.
Easiest way of making Palaada is by using rice flour.

en: [00:00.000] I prefer basmati rice, can be replaced with Sona Masoori rice.
[00:05.000] Soak the rice in water for at least 4 hours.
[00:10.000] After soaking the rice, rinse it under running water till the water turns clear.
[00:15.000] Add the soaked and rinsed rice to a blender jar.
[00:23.000] Add the egg and 2 cups of thin coconut milk.
[00:27.000] Grind to a smooth batter without any grains.
[00:31.000] Pour the batter into a large bowl.
[00:34.000] To make the batter thin, add Â½ cup thin coconut milk and Â½ cup water.
[00:39.000] Add Â½ tsp salt, combine well.
[00:42.000] Place a non-stick pan over medium heat and let it heat up.
[00:46.000] Grease the pan with cooking spray.
[00:49.000] Pour a large spoonful of the batter into the pan.
[00:52.000] Immediately swirl the pan so that the batter spreads thinly and evenly.
[00:56.000] Let cook for 2 minutes until edges turn crispy and lace-like.
[01:00.000] Transfer the palaada or crepe onto a plate.
[01:02.000] Fold the palaada into a semi-circle and then to a triangular shape.
[01:03.000] Enjoy. This is a breakfast delicacy in Kerala, served with chicken, mutton or beef curries.
